attributes.action: Either keep the hacker Gary McKinnon in this country, or openly declare his prejudice and intolerance towards Autistic members of society.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Gary McKinnon, an Asperger's Syndrome sufferer, is soon to be extradited to the US because he was caught hacking into NASA and the Pentagon looking for evidence of extra-terrestrials. Unfortunately, noone in the position to help him stay in this country wants to help him. Which is why we believe Gordon Brown and the Labour party should openly declare their intolerance and prejudice against all members of society that suffer from any form of Autism, or give Gary McKinnon a job to make a better electronic defence against future hackers.

rejection.details: We can not accept petitions about individual legal cases. In this case, the Home Secretary does not have general discretion. He can only stop extradition if he finds that McKinnon’s human rights would be breached.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
